disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents through my deeds?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when struggling to understand the human imperfections of its members during disagreements?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: for the dignity of the deceased
disobedience.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not buried, showing disrespect for the dignity of the deceased?
disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did I schedule non-essential work on a Sunday, potentially disrespecting God's holy day of rest?
disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

condoning.question: Did you through words encourage other Catholics to stay away from Sacraments or Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did you, through your words, lead other Catholics to disregard their obligations to receive Sacraments or participate in Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I use words to encourage fellow Catholics to stay away from sacraments, thereby condoning their absence?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: due to fear of having an uncomfortable conversation
condoning.question: Did I permit my adult child to continue in error due to fear of having an uncomfortable conversation?

condoning.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

condoning.question: Did I condone another Catholic to marry outside the Church through my words?

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while in a state of sin, showing grave disrespect for the sacrament?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence my decisions, especially in situations where I had to prioritize or assert my will over others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: especially in situations where I felt a need to assert control or get my own way

ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence how I lead and treat others, potentially leading to prideful self-exaltation at their expense?

extracted_data_phrases: such as travel or luxury items
greed.question: Did I make acquiring wealth and material possessions, such as travel or luxury items, a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: through my words , actions , or attitudes ,
oppression.question: Have I through my words, actions, or attitudes, mistreated or harassed others?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my relationships, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the comforts of my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

solely to my own hard work and diligence
autonomy.question: Did I attribute the good things in my life, such as financial stability and good health, solely to my own hard work and diligence, forgetting that God's providence is ultimately responsible?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envious of others' good fortune, and secretly wished they would lose their blessings?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I felt envy in my heart when others achieve success or receive blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking on special occasions or at gatherings where social pressure to indulge might be strong?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

prodigality.question: Have I excessive and wasteful gambling to take precedence over my financial obligations, potentially harming my ability to provide for myself or those in need?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I prioritized excessive and wasteful gambling over my financial responsibilities, thereby neglecting my duty to provide for myself and others?

anger.question: Have I nursed anger rather than extending compassion to those closest to me?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger towards someone in my life, rather than seeking reconciliation?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
